parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.76</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of arrays of all vehicle's magazines with extended information about them. Magazine type is available for loaded magazines only, otherwise it is -1.


<br><br>'''Output format''':
<br>[[magazine1],[magazine2],[magazine3]...[magazineN]]

<br><br>'''Magazine format''':
<br>0: Magazine class name
<br>1: Magazine current ammo count
<br>2: Magazine state (true - loaded, false - not loaded)
<br>3: Magazine type (-1 - n/a, 0 - grenade, 1 - primary weapon mag, 2 - handgun mag, 4 - secondary weapon mag, 4096 - binocular weapon mag, 65536 - vehicle mag)
<br>4: Magazine location ("Vest", "Uniform", "Backpack", "") or corresponding [[currentMuzzle]] <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> This command does not return empty magazines from containers, only from the weapon. Use <tt>[[magazinesAmmoCargo]] &lt;container&gt;</tt> instead</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[magazinesAmmoFull]] vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle.  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name> s2</name>=<value> [[magazinesAmmoFull]] [vehicle, includeEmpty] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(Since Arma 3 v1.99.146475)</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [vehicle, includeEmpty]: [[Array]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle.  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> includeEmpty (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to include empty magazines. Default: [[false]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name> r2</name>=<value>[[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value> 
 
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value><code>_magazinesAmmoFull = [[magazinesAmmoFull]] [[player]];
/*
[
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30,false,-1,"Uniform"],
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30,false,-1,"Vest"],
	["16Rnd_9x21_Mag",16,false,-1,"Vest"],
	["SmokeShellGreen",1,true,0,"SmokeShellGreenMuzzle"],
	["Chemlight_green",1,true,0,"ChemlightGreenMuzzle"],
	["HandGrenade",1,true,0,"HandGrenadeMuzzle"],
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30,true,1,"arifle_MX_ACO_pointer_F"],
	["16Rnd_9x21_Mag",16,true,2,"hgun_P07_F"]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>*/</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext></code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value><code>_magazinesAmmoFull = [[magazinesAmmoFull]] Mi_48;
/*
[
	["250Rnd_30mm_APDS_shells",250,false,-1,""],
	["250Rnd_30mm_HE_shells",250,true,65536,"gatling_30mm"],
	["8Rnd_LG_scalpel",8,true,65536,"missiles_SCALPEL"],
	["38Rnd_80mm_rockets",38,true,65536,"rockets_Skyfire"]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>*/</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext></code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[magazinesAmmo]], [[magazinesAmmoCargo]], [[magazinesDetail]], [[magazines]], [[magazinesTurret]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 14:40 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When used on vehicles this will only return all magazines associated with a single turretPath (which one depends on the actual armament of the vehicle, usually the first armed turretPath or alternatively turretPath [-1]). <br>
If you want to get all turrets' magazines, use [[allTurrets]] and [[magazinesTurret]].
--[[User:Actium|Actium]] ([[User talk:Actium|talk]]) 15:40, 20 December 2014 (CET)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 10, 2015 - 04:40 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
As Actium said, this function seems to extract data from:
configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> _the_vehicle_you_want >> "Turrets" >> "MainTurret">> "magazines".
Some vehicles return an empty field {} because magazines are in straight in:
configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> _the_vehicle_you_want >> "magazines" (often dedicated to flares only).

This is the case of WY-55 Hellcat. This function returns an empty array.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 5, 2019 - 22:28 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Yuval|Yuval]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command does not include magazines loaded into weapons stored inside player's backpack (or every other container).
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
